titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Or, The Journies of the Children of Israel : As they are recorded Numbers XXXIII. And in their names and historical passages, comprise the Great and Graduall work of Regeneration, the progresse of which is here also continued as it is further adumbrated by Joshua's leading Israel into the good land and their vanquishing under his conduct the VII Nations' XXXI Kings: in which discourses our various straits and succurs in the spiritual wilderness, our several encounters with and victories over Sinne and Satan, are distinctly represented, and all proportioned to the truth of experience and internall teaching as these correspond with the authentick suffrage of the Holy Scriptures1673

Or, The Journies of the Children of Israel : As they are recorded Numbers XXXIII. And in their names and historical passages, comprise the Great and Graduall work of Regeneration, the progresse of which is here also continued as it is further adumbrated by Joshua's leading Israel into the good land and their vanquishing under his conduct the VII Nations' XXXI Kings: in which discourses our various straits and succurs in the spiritual wilderness, our several encounters with and victories over Sinne and Satan, are distinctly represented, and all proportioned to the truth of experience and internall teaching as these correspond with the authentick suffrage of the Holy Scriptures1673

did.unittitle: Or, The Journies of the Children of Israel : As they are recorded Numbers XXXIII. And in their names and historical passages, comprise the Great and Graduall work of Regeneration, the progresse of which is here also continued as it is further adumbrated by Joshua's leading Israel into the good land and their vanquishing under his conduct the VII Nations' XXXI Kings: in which discourses our various straits and succurs in the spiritual wilderness, our several encounters with and victories over Sinne and Satan, are distinctly represented, and all proportioned to the truth of experience and internall teaching as these correspond with the authentick suffrage of the Holy Scriptures
did.abstract: 1673 manuscript by Thomas Bromley on typology and symbolism in the Bible.

scopecontent.p: 1673 manuscript by Thomas Bromley on typology and symbolism in the Bible. Text includes unpaginated preface, pages numbered 1-189, and unpaginated end pages. Text also exhibits library markings, slight annotations, interlineations, and catchwords.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

controlaccess.subject: Symbolism in the Bible -- Early works to 1800.

controlaccess.title: Bible. -- Numbers XXXIII -- Criticism, interpretation, etc. -- Early works to 1800.
